tool.name: checkm lineage_wf
tool.command:
mkdir bin_folder && #for $k, $f in enumerate($bin_folder) #if $f ln -s "${f}" bin_folder/${k}.fna && #end if #end for
checkm lineage_wf bin_folder '$output.extra_files_path' $reduced_tree $ali $nt $genes #if $unique and $unique is not None: --unique $unique #end if #if $multi and $multi is not None: --multi $multi #end if $force_domain $no_refinement $individual_markers $skip_adj_correction $skip_pseudogene_correction #if $aai_strain and $aai_strain is not None: --aai_strain $aai_strain #end if #if $alignment_file == "true": --alignment_file $alignment_file_output #end if $ignore_thresholds #if $e_value and $e_value is not None: --e_value $e_value #end if #if $length and $length is not None: --length $length #end if --tab_table --threads \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1} > '$output' #if str($ali) == "--ali" or str($nt) == "--nt": &&if [ -d '$output.extra_files_path' ]; then cp -r '$output.extra_files_path' out_folder; fi #end if
## link hmmer alignments per bin in one dir to make them discoverable #if str($ali) == "--ali": && for k in `ls out_folder/bins/`; do if [ -f out_folder/bins/\$k/hmmer.tree.txt ]; then ln -s \$k/hmmer.tree.txt out_folder/bins/hmmer.tree.\$k.txt; fi; if [ -f out_folder/bins/\$k/hmmer.analyze.txt ]; then ln -s \$k/hmmer.analyze.txt out_folder/bins/hmmer.analyze.\$k.txt; fi; done #end if## link nucleotide sequences per bin in one dir to make them discoverable #if str($nt) == "--nt": && for k in `ls out_folder/bins/`; do if [ -f out_folder/bins/\$k/genes.fna ]; then ln -s \$k/genes.fna out_folder/bins/\$k.genes.fna; fi; done #end if

param.label: use reduced tree (requires <16GB of memory) for determining lineage of each bin
param.name: reduced_tree

param.label: generate HMMER alignment file for each bin
param.name: ali

param.label: generate nucleotide gene sequences for each bin
param.name: nt

param.label: bins contain genes as amino acids instead of nucleotide contigs
param.name: genes

param.label: minimum number of unique phylogenetic markers required to use lineage-specific marker set
param.name: unique

param.label: maximum number of multi-copy phylogenetic markers before defaulting to domain-level marker set
param.name: multi

param.label: use domain-level sets for all bins
param.name: force_domain

param.label: do not perform lineage-specific marker set refinement
param.name: no_refinement

param.label: treat marker as independent (i.e., ignore co-located set structure)
param.name: individual_markers

param.label: do not exclude adjacent marker genes when estimating contamination
param.name: skip_adj_correction

param.label: skip identification and filtering of pseudogenes
param.name: skip_pseudogene_correction

param.label: AAI threshold used to identify strain heterogeneity
param.name: aai_strain

param.label: produce file showing alignment of multi-copy genes and their AAI identity
param.name: alignment_file

param.label: percent overlap between target and query
param.name: length
